quest.name: Like Mother, Like Daughter
journal: Brother E–Sumi–Yan requires your assistance in a matter concerning the young conjurer, Sylphie.

After disappearing from the guild without a word, Sylphie was later spotted by a party of conjurers in the South Shroud. Brother E–Sumi has requested that you travel to the area and escort the wayward child back to Gridania. Speak first with Wulfiue in Buscarron's Druthers to learn more of the young conjurer's present state of mind.

Wulfiue has explained that Sylphie, with her sensitivity to the voices of the elementals, must be troubled by the powerful disturbance discovered to the southeast of Buscarron's Druthers. Speak with Sylphie and see how she fares.

Upon reading her mother's journal, Sylphie has become convinced that conjury is to blame for inciting the wrath of nature. Fearing that the party of Hearers sent to cleanse the corruption are further angering the Twelveswood, the young conjurer sets off to stop them. Catch up to Sylphie before she stumbles into danger.
With a helping hand from nature, you have managed to cleanse the massive manifestation of corrupted earth. Speak with Sylphie and learn what the young conjurer is thinking.
After witnessing the battle, Sylphie has conceded that perhaps nature is not as frightening as she believed. Return to Stillglade Fane and report to Brother E–Sumi.

Having learned of her mother's honest, though misguided, motivations, Sylphie is now determined to embrace the power of nature. At long last, the young conjurer seems to have put her personal troubles behind her. The general mood of hope is dampened, however, by the revelation that the Twelveswood is suffering from some widespread and as-yet-unknown affliction. Return to your studies and seek greater mastery over your art in preparation for the day when Brother E–Sumi calls upon you once more.

※The next conjurer quest will be available from E–Sumi–Yan upon reaching level 30.
objectives: Speak with Wulfiue at Buscarron's Druthers.
Report to Brother E–Sumi–Yan at Stillglade Fane.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Welcome, Forename. The tales of your deeds reach me even here in the cloistered heart of Stillglade Fane.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Glad I am that you have come, for I would ask your assistance in a matter of some delicacy. It concerns, yes, young Sylphie once again...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: As you can no doubt imagine, the recent revelations concerning her mother have sorely troubled the poor child.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: It appears Sylphie needed some time alone to sort through the whirlwind of emotions which now beset her. She has, in short, fled from the guild.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Fortunately, a party of conjurers who were dispatched to the South Shroud to investigate another instance of corruption sent word that they have spotted our wayward Sylphie.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Considering the importance of their mission, I would not seek to distract the conjurers from their task. Thus, I turn to you to escort Sylphie back here to the guild. You are, I believe, one of the few people to whom she will listen.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Pray travel to Buscarron's Druthers and speak with Wulfiue. She was the conjurer who first chanced upon Sylphie, and will be able to tell you more of how the young lady fares.

dialogue.name: WULFIUE
dialogue.text: We meet again, Forename. I assume Brother E–Sumi warned you of the corruption my companions and I have been tasked with purifying here in the South Shroud?

dialogue.name: WULFIUE
dialogue.text: The source of this extensive blight is found to the southeast─the shrill, discordant voices of the elementals shriek their dismay in the vicinity of the withered treant. I suggest you give the area a wide berth.

dialogue.name: WULFIUE
dialogue.text: Considering the potential dangers, you might imagine how alarmed I was to discover young Sylphie wandering about this part of the Twelveswood. It seems that her mother─a woman who healed with conjury, but remained untrained by the guild─called this region her home.

dialogue.name: WULFIUE
dialogue.text: Sylphie herself had her head buried in some manner of tome, but if she is as sensitive to the elementals' murmurings as I am led to believe, then the din within her mind must be driving her to distraction.

dialogue.name: WULFIUE
dialogue.text: Pray speak with the child and see that she is well. I would do so myself if our current duty were not so pressing. We will, in fact, be setting out at any moment.

dialogue.name: NOLANEL
dialogue.text: Forename, you have grown much since last we spoke of the mysteries of earth. Though you are no doubt capable of defending yourself, I must nonetheless advise you against venturing out into the wilds until such time as balance has been restored.

dialogue.name: JOACIN
dialogue.text: Wulfiue divines the will of air, Nolanel is deeply rooted in earth, and I claim some small degree of mastery over water. False modesty aside, that we three were chosen to respond to this disturbance suggests that the situation is dire indeed.

dialogue.name: WULFIUE
dialogue.text: We are soon to depart on our mission. I am, however, relieved to know that you are here to speak with Sylphie and safeguard her well-being.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Forename!? Ah, I should've known that Wulfiue would tattle on me! And Brother E–Sumi sent you to take me back, didn't he?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: This is where my mother used to live, you know. Right up until she...passed on, folk were grateful for the healing she offered.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: And this is the journal she used to keep. There's an entry that explains how nature becomes furious when conjurers use their art; how there are always more people wounded in battles when “mortals abuse the power that is not theirs to take.”

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: My mother refused to draw on nature, because she was scared of making it angry.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: She wouldn't lie about such things, and I want to do what she would've wanted. I'm going to stop using conjury altogether!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Unnngh... I've never heard the voices this mad before.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I bet it's because Wulfiue and the others are overusing their art. We have to go and stop them!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Gods, it's so loud... Can't you hear it? Nature is shrieking in rage...

dialogue.name: NOLANEL
dialogue.text: Never has the earth so confounded me... I must apologize.

dialogue.name: WULFIUE
dialogue.text: Thank you for your timely assistance. With the origin of the corruption now neutralized, we should be able to cleanse whatever traces remain.

dialogue.name: JOACIN
dialogue.text: You possess quite an affinity for the elements... That was most impressive.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I... I can't believe nature actually helped us.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: There was nothing scary about it at all.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I might still wonder if it really was safe for conjurers to borrow that power if I hadn't seen the way you wield it. Nothing could seem more...natural. I think it's time I went back to the guild.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: There are a few things I need to collect first, so, please, go on ahead without me.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. And you also, Sylphie.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Brother E–Sumi, I'm sorry I ran away like that...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: I understand, child. Did you find the answers you sought?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Yes─thanks to Forename. SheHe showed me that nature was nothing to be afraid of.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: ...I think I know why my mother refused to call upon its power─she believed the act caused suffering to nature itself.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: I see.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: So it was her very love for nature that prevented her from drawing on its strength.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Tell me, Sylphie─has the fog of indecision now lifted from your mind?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: It has, Guildmaster. I understand now why my mother chose the path she did.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Full glad am I to hear that, for I must ask of you one more question.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Yes, Brother E–Sumi?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: When you first witnessed Forename cleanse a corrupted element, you mentioned hearing voices. How exactly did they sound?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: The voices? Well...they sounded joyful, like a crowd letting out a sudden cheer. I really heard them, I swear!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: I am sure you did, Sylphie. This is a gift.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Conjurers may sense the power of nature, and borrow from its strength. But not all can hear its whispers.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: What you describe are the voices of the elementals. You may very well possess the talent to become a Hearer.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: A Hearer!?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Of course, much relies on your studies of conjury. You have a natural aptitude, but have thus far lacked commitment. You must not neglect your training, Sylphie.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Putting aside such matters for a moment, I am curious to hear about the disturbance you observed in the South Shroud, Forename. I assume from the reports I have received that it was of a different magnitude to those which you have previously encountered. Am I correct?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Hmmm... This bodes ill. The creatures known as “mud pies” are not native to the Twelveswood. I wonder what relation this may have to the seemingly ever-increasing frequency of these disturbances.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Something beyond the damage wrought by the Calamity afflicts the Twelveswood. I shall commune with the elementals and seek to identify this threat.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Forename, Sylphie, I may have need of you both before long. Until then, give yourselves over to the study of our art.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Ever shall the earth meet your footfall, and the wind guide your path.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Nature is angry with us...
You mustn't use any more conjury!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: We are only making nature more furious!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Even the creatures of the woods know this is wrong!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Now nature sends thunder and lightning against us!
What more proof do you need!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Elementals!? Are they angry too!?
We're really in trouble now!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: They... The elementals are helping us!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Never has the earth so confounded me...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I can muster no second wind...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: My well has run dry...
